data.title: Bill Gates..........

data.text:
2. BIRTH OF BILL GATES *

3. *OCCUPATION – CO-CHAIR OF THE BILL & MELINDA GATES FOUNDATION. CEO OF CASCADE INVESTMENT CHAIRMAN OF CORBIES.

4. William H. Gates, Sr. Mary Maxwell Gates

5. BILL GATES AND HER WIFE MELINDA GATES WORKS TOGETHER AND THEY BOTH ARE HANDLING THEIR OWN FOUNDATION…..

6. Q HISTORY *He had an early interest in software and Become programming software at the age of 13. *In 1973 bill gates became a student at HARVARD UNIVERSITY where he meet STEVE BALLMER(NOW MICROSOFT CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER). *While still a harvard undergraduate bill gates wrote a version of the programming language BASIC from the MITS Altair microcomputer.

7. *In 1975,before graduation gates left Harvard to from Microsoft with his childhood friend Paul Allen. The pair planned to developed software newly emerging personal computer market. *Bill gates company Microsoft became famous for their computer operating system and killer business deals. *On November 10,1983 at the Plaza hotel in New York city Microsoft cooperation formally announced . Microsoft windows a next generation operating system.

8. MICROSOFT DEVELOP *Bill Gates was inspired to invent Microsoft because he saw the world was helpless without ways to communicate find information so, that’s why bill gates invented Microsoft. *Microsoft is the multinational company technology cooperation. The history of microsoft began on April 4,1975 . *It current best selling products are the microsoft windows operating system and the microsoft office suite of productivity software. *The company has now become largely successful. As of 2013 microsoft has a global annual revenue of US$77.85 billion and nearly 110,000 employees in 105 countries. It develops manufactures, licenses and support a wide range of software products for computing devices.

9. *1975-1985 - FOUNDATION OF MICROSOFT MICROSOFT STAFF , ALBUQUERQUE , DECEMBER 7, 1978 TOP :STEVE WOOD,BOB WALLACE,JIM LANE MIDDLE:BOB-O’REAR,BOB GREEN BERG,MARC MCDONALDS,GORDON LETWIN BOTTOM:BILL GATES,ANDREA LEWIS,MARLA WOOD,PAUL ALLEN SOFTWARE DEVELOPED BY BILL GATES

10. *1985-1991 - RISE AND FALL OF OS/2 *1992-1995 - DOMINATION OF THE COORPORATIVE MARKET *1995-1999 - FORAY INTO THE WEB AND OTHER VENTURES *2000-2005 - LEGAL ISSUES , WINDOWS XP AND DOT NET *2005-2014 - VISTA, WINDOWS 7 & 8

11. HOW BILL GATES ORGANISATION STARTED

12. AWARDS *In 2006 , the foundation won the PRINCE of ASTURIAS award for international cooperation. *In 2007 , then the president of India PRATIBA DEVISINGH PATIL presented by INDRA GANDHI prize for peace , disarmament and development to the bill & melinda foundation

13. TOTAL PARTNERS OF BILL GATES

14. IBM PARTNERSHIP *IBM APPROACHED MICROSOFT IN JULY 1980 TO PROVIDE THE OPERATING SYSTEM FOR ITS UPCOMING PERSONAL COMPUTER *GATES OVERSAW MICROSOFT'S COMPANY RESTRUCTURING IN JUNE 1981, WHICH RE- INCORPORATED THE COMPANY IN WASHINGTON STATE AND MADE GATES PRESIDENT OF MICROSOFT AND THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD.

15. WORLD 1ST PC’S GAME CO-WRITTEN BY BILL GATES

16. C CARLOS SLIM HEL $69 BILLION BILL GATES $61 BILLION WARREN BUFFET $44 BILLION BERNARD ARNAULT $41 BILLION AMANICO ORTEGA $37.5 BILLION CHARLES KOCH $35.4 BILLION

17. BOOKS AND VIDEOS OF BILL GATES

19. IN 1994 SOLD SOME OF HIS MICROSOFT STOCK TO CREATE THE WILLIAM H. GATES FOUNDATION. IN 2000, GATES AND HIS WIFE COMBINED THREE FAMILY FOUNDATIONS INTO ONE TO CREATE THE CHARITABLE BILL & MELINDA GATES FOUNDATION, WHICH IS THE LARGEST TRANSPARENTLY OPERATES OF 2007, BILL AND MELINDA GATES WERE THE SECOND-MOST GENEROUS PHILANTHROPISTS IN AMERICA, HAVING GIVEN OVER $28 BILLION TO CHARITY.THEY PLAN TO EVENTUALLY GIVE 95% OF THEIR WEALTH TO CHARITY. PHILANTHROPHY

20. RECOGNITION  YEAR RECOGNITION  1994 Honoured as the twentieth Distinguished Fellow  1998 Top 50 cyber Elite  1999 Ranked number two in the upside Elite 100 2001 The Guardian as one of the "Top 100 influential people in media"  2004, 2005, 2006 Time magazine named Gates one of the 100 people who most influenced the 20th  2005 Persons of the year 

21. 1. QUOTATIONS
